definition: providing specific details or circumstances, a fact about some part, as opposed to the whole
details:
adjective
- providing specific details or circumstances
- surpassing what is common or usual or expected
= synonyms: especial, exceptional, special
- unique or specific to a person or thing or category
= synonyms: peculiar, special
- separate and distinct from others of the same group or category
- exacting especially about details
= synonyms: finical
- first and most important
= synonyms: special
noun
- a fact about some part, as opposed to the whole
= example: a fact about some part, as opposed to the whole
= synonyms: specific
- (logic) a proposition that asserts something about some (but not all) members of a class
= synonyms: particular proposition
- a small part that can be considered separately from the whole
= synonyms: item
